document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Career and Technical Education

Rights Clarification Act of 1997;

475C7E4B2A794A0E969012CA922BF7A2.description: The student analyzes law related to victims and witnesses. The student is expected to:

3D8BA44EC39D45A4909AC1910EA068B6.description: demonstrate strategies to enhance public trust;

7991EE055EF244488DF8AB69E137335A.description: examine elements that an officer must recognize and control in every encounter.

070CB2F0F8DF454D9E59672B268261F4.description: discuss force options available to peace officers;Â

2C17B84AAC564FB28C0B1CAB7500F7CA.description: analyze the deciding factors for use of force when effecting an arrest;

D7B1A9F11D784E2BBB456B869269C324.description:

B4C6B79DDB5F4CF2A4AF9B4A603BF542.description:
The student demonstrates professional standards/employability skills as required by business and
industry. The student is expected to achieve business and industry employability skills standards
such as attendance, on-time arrival, meeting deadlines, working toward personal/team goals every
day, and ethical use of technology.

9BF0F1F63D2C44538F5598121C58ACB7.description:
Statements that contain the word "including" reference content that must be mastered, while those
containing the phrase "such as" are intended as possible illustrative examples

9A567AFBF96B4392A643EF3ADF4F3389.description:
Students are encouraged to participate in extended learning experiences such as career and
technical student organizations and other leadership or extracurricular organizations

87834FE3982749D284962DD5964C542B.description:
Law Enforcement I is an overview of the history, organization, and functions of local, state, and
federal law enforcement. Students will understand the role of constitutional law at local, state, and
federal levels; the U.S. legal system; criminal law; and law enforcement terminology and the
classification and elements of crime.

FD26213077064657B526E1ECCDB87FCD.description:
The Law, Public Safety, Corrections, and Security Career Cluster focuses on planning, managing,
and providing legal services, public safety, protective services, and homeland security, including
professional and technical support services.

65A53B162FEC4A0BA5B2B5C8D9BC0073.description:
Career and technical education instruction provides content aligned with challenging academic
standards and relevant technical knowledge and skills for students to further their education and
succeed in current or emerging professions

7CD7990B2FF64FCCA0A9699F43D58BB8.description:
General requirements. This course is recommended for students in Grades 10-12. Recommended
prerequisite: Principles of Law, Public Safety, Corrections, and Security. Students shall be awarded one
credit for successful completion of this course.
